poem:
Title: The Recount of Pence and Measures

Rising with the sun, a spectral four,
eyelids heavy with November's lore.
Broadcaster of tarnished figures is she,
inspectress of the everyday we see.

In my bread-basket, a quiet cost,
in my socks' fabric, a penny lost. 
Echoes of percentages in the hall,
prices whisper in a numbers brawl.

Money's tale, a changeable fact,
Inflation's song rings through, exact.
